data.title: Added Tiberian Dawn mission GDI 07
data.body: See http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Finish_The_Nod_Base for reference. I left the original atk\* trigger names intact, so you can compare easier with the original mission configuration.

data.title: Fix TS debris angles.
data.body: I r lazy. I'm aware the lint rules ain't written yet but I've noticed this bug pops up too many times now to be ignored.

data.title: Fix outdated file headers.
Incomplete map upgrade
data.body:
While converting format 6 to 11 the following did not work:
- Removal of `UseAsShellmap: False`
- Removal of `Selectable: True`
- Removal of `Options: FragileAlliances: False`
- Translation of `Players: PlayerReference: Race:` to `Players: PlayerReference: Faction:`
- Conversion of actor health from float to int.

data.title: Add Marn's Shellmap "Fields of Green" to TS
data.body: ![screen shot 2016-04-09 at 10 02 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/14407942/ac0362c8-fea3-11e5-84fb-95f3acf7825a.png)

data.title: Expose CashTrickler trait in lua map script
data.body:
It would be nice to have CaptureAmount, and the others, available in lua script.  The impact is minimal, I was trying to message players at the start of a game what amount they'd get, if they chose to capture certain buildings.
Example from map.yaml:

```
Actor131: ANCIENTSILO
    Owner: Neutral
    Location: 10,14

Rules:
    ANCIENTSILO:
        Inherits: silo
        CashTrickler:
            CaptureAmount: 2000
            Amount: 0
            ShowTicks: false
```

data.title: Move Spectators & Team chat labels before player nickname
data.body: Proposal for #11078. This moves (Spectators) and (Team) to appear before the player's name, and in square brackets. This removes some ambiguity and also keeps the other suffixes (Ally) (Spectator) (Dead) to all chat.

data.title: Voxel renderer glitch
data.body:
This is an old one and tbh I'm reporting it as a FYI/let you guys be aware.

If the renderer performance is slow and there are a lot of big voxels (tend to see this with choppers involved which are bigger than tanks) then shadows start to flicker and misrender, throwing weird frames like these.

![openra-2016-04-09t201450zexample](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1136302/14406208/ad6d4d74-fea1-11e5-9f7a-97ac22f31693.png)
![openra-2016-04-09t201453z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1136302/14406216/0c9c3bac-fea2-11e5-975e-e9c0fcb2d40a.png)

Notice how on the latter one, the whacked copter's shadow seems cropped apparently, but sometimes it adds additional voxel shadows into the plane's bounding box (cropped other tanks, whatnot) and stuff like that. This only happens at extreme render lag though only, so I can imagine that 2 rendering frame ends up using the same buffer during voxel rendering or stuff like that.

Flickering is the keyword though. And after the lag gets better, it will run fine again.

data.title: Fix and improve lobby custom rules warning.
data.body: Fixes #11068, and improves the check so that maps with custom lighting and/or weather effects don't trigger the warning.

data.title: Fix left click orders
data.body: Fixes #11041.

data.title: Pre-built walls and fences (neutral) are invisible with 'explored map'.
data.body: Relevant issue for both players and spectators. Many official maps have fences, some around oil derricks, e.g. it's a bit awkward revealing fences when you approach oil derricks. Also maps such as Keep of The Grass 2 has walls defending the middle ore/gems.

data.title: Fix several NREs during setup of client tooltips in GameInfoStatsLogic
data.body: Fixes #11040.

data.title: 20160403 Playtest - Spectator chat labels almost indistinguishable
data.body:
```
SoScared (Spectator): I can chat with everyone - specs, players, (dead) players.
SoScared (Spectators): My chat is only visible to other spectators.
```

Might seems clear enough here but when you're in-game, it's easy to make a mistake when there's a lot of action and excitement involved. Also different chat colors might be a bit difficult to read in specific situations.

data.title: Mammoth Tank Speed Buff
data.body:
Increase Mammoth tank speed from 42 to 50

It seems like every attack done with Mammoth tank nowadays is a guaranteed suicide run. When target fired upon the tank simply can't get away in time. Pulling back damaged Mammoths in time for health regeneration isn't working. The ability of crushing walls in the playtest is great but only accounts for use in specific situations. 

For comparisons, the Soviet MAD tank moves at speed 54. Zombies at 42 :)

The current Mammoth Tank is a sleeping beast.

data.title: Fix issues with the insufficient funds warning
data.body:
This fixes several issues with the insufficient funds warning, as well as an unrelated polish issue with the production code.
1. Fixes several warnings being played at once by moving the logic that ultimately causes the sound to be played from from the production queues to `PlayerResources`.
2. Fixes warnings being played shortly after one another by adding a customizable delay.
3. Adds notifications being triggered by repairs.
4. Fixes #11052.
5. Fixes #11073.

Another difference between this implementation and the old one is that the new one will keep repeating the warning (at the interval of the delay) until funds are available again.

data.title: TD SAM Site and Advanced Guard Tower delay before building cost applies
data.body:
When building these, the building process starts but money isn't taken from the player until construction is about 1/8th done. Production cannot be put on hold during this time, instead the building is cancelled, which made me think this isn't working as intended.

Possibly related to [#11073](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11073)?

data.title: Can't check the ready box after installing a map
data.body: Reported on @SoScared's last Monday Stream.

data.title: TD SAM site and advanced guard tower don't play building notifications
data.body: See title

data.title: Add a checkbox for the data collection to the installer
data.body:
or add some kind of popup when the game first starts as suggested [in the comments section](http://www.openra.net/#comment-2611870483).

I think adding a `[x] Allow OpenRA to collect anonymous statistics (about xyz)`
(checked by default) to the installer is a good idea.

data.title: TD Custom Map Tabs
data.body:
When uploading a custom map from the resource center into the folder no custom tab pops up.

However, if I put it into the Playtest folder map directory directly, it does not pop up with a custom tab but the map shows up in official maps tab.

data.title: TD Selling = Mass Engineers
data.body:
Selling simple structures such as a power plant gives one engineer. Selling a refinery gives about six engineers. 

This is pretty badly broken in which the enemy can sell out a bunch of structures (Even early on) and do quick capturing. Which then can be sold for more engineers and capture more stuff.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/2bpinhzcf1d1zkj/OpenRA-2016-04-08T055654Z.orarep?dl=0

Official map: Two Ponds

data.title: Official maps displaying "modded map, experience will change etc."
data.body: Was on a server AoAGeneral was hosting and all the official maps came up with the modded map warning.

data.title: Remove lower selection priority for engineers in TD
data.body:
I said on one of the original post that making a lower selection priority for engineers in TD would be counter-productive since they are used differently to everything in RA except the spy.
Could you please remove this from TD

data.title: Add ranks to paratroopers
data.body:
poll : http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19535

this is more of a "polish" instead of a "balance"-ticket,
we could either spread the ranks randomly everytime a paradrop is happening ... or have them set in a specific order which never changes ... here a example : 
- E1 - 4th rank (Star)
- E2 - 3rd rank (3 Stripes)
- E2 - 2nd rank (2 Stripes)
- E1 - 1st rank (1 Stripe)
- E1 - unranked

(i personally would enjoy the "random" assignment on every drop ... but im indifferent on the implementation)

data.title: Add a lua method for querying all actors that are currently InWorld
data.body: As requested to fight the abuse of `Map.ActorsInBox`. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8549.

data.title: Rocket soldier sometimes misses the target
data.body:
I found a bug where a rocket soldier sometimes misses his target.
The direction is important. The target must be directly above the rocket soldier.

[Video demonstration](https://www.dropbox.com/s/8mzsi2yraqvoi2u/openra-rocket-soldier-bug.mp4?dl=0)

![monosnap 2016-04-07 22-02-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/14363361/7769d666-fd0c-11e5-8e9c-65efe1ae87b3.png)

This bug occurs both in release-20151224 and playtest-20160403, but in the playtest the chance of missing is a bit lower (might be subjective).

data.title: idea - let servers to use custom maps.
data.body:
Lot of gamers has'nt white IP, but want to play with selfmaded maps together.

Now, If they connect to official ORA server and try to use custom map, server do not load the map.
if the servers will download custom maps, it will be a very useful feature

data.title: Game drops to crawl speed
data.body:
I created a map and noticed that the game's speed drops to crawl speed online.
Offline i have not experienced any issues, well i had a issue when there were no ore mines but after i added 7 or 8 the frame game started to function correctly can anyone help me trouble shoot this issue.
Is this because of this map or something else.

This is the map
http://resource.openra.net/maps/11468/
